title: Nick Meaney
text:
Nick Meaney (born 10 September 1997) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a and er for the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm%20">Melbourne Storm </a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>. 
He previously played for the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> and <a href="Canterbury%20Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury Bankstown Bulldogs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>.
Background.
Meaney was born in <a href="Lismore%2C%20New%20South%20Wales%2C%20Australia">Lismore, New South Wales, Australia</a>. He is the grandson of former <a href="Manly%20Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Warringah Sea Eagles</a> and <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs Magpies</a> player <a href="Denis%20Meaney">Denis Meaney</a>. Meaney was educated at <a href="St%20John%27s%20College%2C%20Woodlawn">St John's College, Woodlawn</a>.
He played his junior rugby league for the <a href="Ballina%20Seagulls">Ballina Seagulls</a>, before being signed by the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>.
Playing career.
Early years.
In 2016, Meaney played for the Newcastle Knights' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team, being named their NYC Player of the Year, before graduating to their <a href="Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">Intrust Super Premiership NSW</a> team in 2017. In May 2017, he was named 19th man for the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Residents%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales Residents</a> in their clash against the <a href="Queensland%20Residents%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland Residents</a>. Later that same month, he played for the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> under-20s team against the <a href="Queensland%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> under-20s team. At the end of the 2017 season, he was awarded the Knights' ISP NSW Player of the Year. In September 2017, he re-signed with the Knights on a 1-year contract until the end of 2018.
2018.
Meaney suffered an ankle injury in the first round of the Knights' Intrust Super Premiership NSW campaign, facing a lengthy recovery period, before returning in round 12. With new recruit <a href="Kalyn%20Ponga">Kalyn Ponga</a> establishing himself as the Knights' first-choice fullback, Meaney signed a 3-year contract with the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a> starting in 2019, looking for a better opportunity to play first-grade. In round 18 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20season">2018 NRL season</a>, he made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the Knights against the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>, after a <a href="hamstring">hamstring</a> injury to Ponga. He went on to play 5 games in his debut year, scoring two tries and kicking one goal, his final game for the Knights, playing at fullback in his side's 14-24 loss against the <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra Dragons</a> in round 25.
2019.
In round 25 of the <a href="2019%20NRL%20season">2019 NRL season</a>, Meaney scored a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> and kicked 5 goals as Canterbury defeated Brisbane 30-14 at <a href="ANZ%20Stadium">ANZ Stadium</a> in the last match of the season. Canterbury missed out on the finals finishing 12th on the table.
2020.
Meaney made 16 appearances for Canterbury in the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>. He finished as the side's top point scorer. The club finished in 15th place on the table, only avoiding the <a href="Wooden%20Spoon%20%28award%29">Wooden Spoon</a> by for and against.
2021.
Midway through the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a>, Meaney signed a contract to join <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne</a> starting in the 2022 season.
In the final round of the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a>, Meaney scored two tries for Canterbury in a 38-0 victory over the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>, in a season where the Bulldogs finished 16th..
